case_vignette: A 14-YEAR-OLD MALE WITH NO PERTINENT PAST MEDICAL HISTORY PRESENTS WITH A PAINLESS GROWING BLACK SPOT ON HIS LEFT HAND AND ARM. STATES HE THINKS IT MAY HAVE OCCURED AFTER WORKING WITH FARM ANIMALS INCLUDING PIGS, SHEEP, AND CATTLE ON HIS PARENTS FARM. PARENTS STATES IT BEGAN AS A YELLOW PUS SPOT THAT SLOWLY ENLARGENED AND POPPED WITH YELLOW FLUID EXITING. REVIEW OF SYMPTOMS REMARKABLE FOR NEW SHORTNESS OF BREATH AND OTHERWISE NEGATIVE. EXAMINATION REVEALED AN EDEMATOUS PINK-BROWN VIOLACEOUS PLAQUES WITH CENTRAL NECROTIC ESCHARSAND SURROUNDING ERYTHEMA ON THE LEFT HAND AND ARM. PUNCH BIOPSY IS PERFORMED AND DEMONSTRATES GRAM POSITIVE SPORE-FORMING RODS.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painless growing black spot on my left hand and arm.
How long have you noticed the spot and has its appearance changed over time?
It began as a yellow pus spot that slowly enlarged and popped with yellow fluid coming out. Now it has turned into a black spot.
Have you recently been outdoors or in contact with any animals or insects?
Yes, I have been working with farm animals including pigs, sheep, and cattle on my parents' farm.
Do you have any accompanying symptoms like fever, body aches, or swollen lymph nodes?
No, I do not have any of those symptoms, but I have experienced new shortness of breath.
Do you have any other health conditions, or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I do not have any other health conditions and I am not taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Anthrax
